ACKNOWLEDGING.Definition: to accept, admit, or recognise something, or the truth or existence of something

ACTIONABLE.Definition: if advice is actionable, you can take action based on it

CLASSIFY.Definition: to divide things or people into groups according to their type, or to say which group or type something or someone belongs to

CLIP.Definition: a short part of a film or television programme

COMPONENT.Definition: a part that combines with other parts to form something bigger

DISTINCTIVE.Definition: something that is distinctive is easy to recognise because it is different from other things

DREADED.Definition: used to refer to something that you do not like or want

END OF.Definition: used to say that 'no more needs to be said'

IMITATING.Definition: to behave in a similar way to someone or something else, or to copy the speech or behaviour, etc. of someone or something

LIPS.Definition: one of the two soft, red edges of the mouth

MANAGEABLE.Definition: easy or possible to deal with

MIMICKING.Definition: copying the way in which a particular person usually speaks and moves, usually in order to make people laugh

MYTHS.Definition: a commonly believed but false idea

NECESSARILY.Definition: used in negatives to mean 'in every case' or 'therefore'

OUT LOUD.Definition: if you say or read something out loud, you say or read it so that other people can hear you

PINPOINT.Definition: to find out or say the exact position in space or time of something

STRESS.Definition: the way that a word or syllable is pronounced with greater force than other words in the same sentence or other syllables in the same word

STRUGGLE.Definition: to experience difficulty and make a very great effort in order to do something

SUBCONSCIOUS.Definition: the part of your mind that notices and remembers information when you are not actively trying to do so, and influences your behaviour even though you do not realise it

TRUTHFULNESS.Definition: the quality of being honest and not containing or telling any lies
